conversations.content: She shone more brilliantly than anyone I'd ever seen.
She was as a beautiful rose, blooming in the summer sun.
It's so hot... I'm burning up! How much longer until we get to the beach?
Griping and moaning will not make it any cooler. More walking, less talking.
Mew wouldn't understand, Chelle... Mew with your convenient outfit changes...
But my beautiful, fluffy fur makes the heat simply clawful!
Mrow?!
Eep!
*sigh* This is what happens when you bumble about like that.
My deepest apologies for this FERAL feline's behavior. Are you unharmed?
Pretty...
Oh, I'm so sorry! I've just never seen anyone as pretty as you before, Miss.
My! Aren't you the sweetest thing? Go on, Cat Sìth. You owe her an apology.
*sniff* My apawlogies...
To be fair, though, Chelle, SHE was the one spacing out in the middle of the road.
Oh...
Interested in the upper windows of this mansion, are we? It's the mayor's house, I believe.
If I recall, the mayor has a son. Could it be that you have your heart set on him?
How did you know?!
A lady has her ways.
I'm just looking, though. We live in two different worlds, after all...
So you won't do it if I don't order you? I just thought...
...the two of us could...
So it's a problem of social standing.
A cat could easily make it from this wall to the window frame, couldn't it, Cat Sìth?
Er... Most likely?
Then I'd like one of my kittens to come here. One who is nimble, if you would. Don't keep me waiting.
Mew use your kittens for everything, I swear.
Do you know how to write?
Um... A little...
A little is enough. Now, come along. We must procure some stationery.
Why...?
To make up for that little collision earlier, I will lend you my assistance.
I'm quite skilled with these matters.
A few days later...
*pant* I finally found you! The lady from before!
Ah, we meet again. How do you do?
I'm okay... But that doesn't matter! Look at this!
Oh, he responded to our letter. What seems to be the problem?
That's just it—he REPLIED to my LETTER! And he said he wanted me to send another one! What are we gonna do?!
I anticipated he might. After all, he received a strange letter from a cat on his windowsill, with such perfectly refined contents...
Anyone would want to know who sent it. Especially a curious boy his age.
Have you met him before?
Heavens, no. But there are plenty of things one can infer without having met a person.
Wow... It feels like you know him better than I do.
He actually saved me once, you know.
Some items went missing at a storefront and everyone thought I was the thief.
I'm an orphan, and I'm really poor, so I didn't have anyone who would vouch for me.
But he was there. And he was on my side.
I thought I'd be happy just gazing up at him from the road, but after his reply, I wanna know more about him...
So please, Miss!
Help us be together!
You've always been by my side. You've always protected me. You're the only one I can trust.
This is not an order. But I want you to listen...
Hold it right there!
Chelle came here to be on holiday. She simply cannot be troubled with—
Silence, Cat Sìth.
Mrow?! Chelle?!
Very well. With my genius, I will make certain that he returns your affection.
What is the meowning of this? Why are mew looking after this street rat?
Because social standing is of no consequence when it comes to matters of the heart.
...Um, Miss? What do you mean? Are you someone super important?
...That is irrelevant to the matter at hand.
I'm naught but a friendly stranger helping you with your love life. That's all you need to know, is it not?
Yeah... I guess so...
Excellent. Then let us begin your lesson in summer love!
And so our story began... A story of a shimmering, beautiful summer with her.
It's working... It's working, Miss! It's happening just like you said it would!
He said he wanted to meet me in his letter today! It's a dream come true!
Now, now. Let's not be too hasty. This is when it gets thorny.
I know. When I meet him, I need to tell him how I feel, and—
No, that won't do at all.
It won't?
Not one bit. Men can smell desperation, and once they do, it's over.
You must instead make HIM fall for YOU.
But... That doesn't feel right...
While we are wont to reach for the stars, seizing one is no simple feat.
Yet their strength and nobility fascinates, making us want them more than ever.
Embody that. BECOME a star. Once you do, his heart will be yours before you can say, ＂twinkle, twinkle.＂
But I don't have any parents... And I'm poor. I'm...not like you.
Just do as I say and everything will be fine.
Well... All right.
The day of the date...
I read that book you told me about in your letters. It was awesome!
(I only wrote about that book because that nice lady told me to.)
(She let me borrow it afterward, but there were so many words I didn't know that I couldn't even read half of it.)
(If I'd known this was gonna happen, I wouldn't have pretended I could read it.)
What was your favorite part?
Um... I guess I liked the beginning?
Wait, you mean before the adventure even started?
Yeah...
Oh... Uh, well, I really liked the part where they were fighting off that big monster...
(I didn't get to that part. I mean, I couldn't read it!)
You're really interesting, y'know that? I could tell from your letters.
(They were just full of stuff that lady told me to write.)
(I'm not interesting at all. And I'm definitely not a star.)
(I was so excited for today, but now it all feels like one big lie. This is awful.)
(He looks like he's feeling really awkward too. He's never gonna wanna see me again after this. Maybe I should just—)
Hey... I have something to tell you.
*sob*
Dry your tears, now. You should not let yourself cry so easily. It's unbecoming of a lady.
Now, tell me what happened. I can mostly surmise, but I'd like to hear it from you.
I told him I had a crush on him.
And how did he react?
He turned me down...and he ran away.
*sigh* I told you the bud of romance would wilt ere it blossoms if you went head-on.
I DID try what I could to make it happen—
I know you did! But it just felt like my feelings weren't even my own anymore!
I'm sorry...
Goodness me-ow. SHE was the one who wanted YOUR advice. Seems pawfully rude of her, doesn't it?
Indeed. It should have been simple for someone with my resources to kindle a romance between two young lovebirds.
But it appears that that wasn't what she needed.
I suppose my way—using any means necessary to get what I want—was simply too much for such an innocent girl.
Does that mean you're throwing in the meowl?
Of course not. While I may not possess her childlike innocence, I have a cunning wit all my own. And I intend to use it.
This summer has only just begun.
I am no longer a child who lets her words or emotions get the best of her.
But some may say that means I have lost my childhood innocence—that I have instead let adulthood tarnish me.
Even still, I am proud of the person I am today.
That is why I simply cannot abide by this.
I must say, this is very unlike mew, Chelle.
Why go so far for a little girl who could not even follow your simple instructions?
This is a matter of my pride as an adult.
And whatever could mew mean by that?
As adults, we believe the ends justify the means. But I cannot abide anyone thinking that makes us incapable of dreaming.
Because we can. Even without our childlike wonder. In fact, there are some dreams we can only make true BECAUSE of our age.
I need that little girl to understand that.
Mew never know when to give up, do you, Chelle?
Of course I don't. ＂Quit＂ is not a word in my vocabulary.
Now, for our next step... Let us commence our summer ball!
Where are we? And...what's with this dress?
Less talking, more walking, dearie.
(It's like I'm in a faerie tale.)
Excuse me, sir. I've brought the girl.
Oh, is this her?!
Um... Who is this?
He's going to be your new foster father.
What? I don't—
Hello there, sweetheart. I've heard all about you from the princess. I would love to raise you as my own.
Wait, ＂the princess＂?
Speaking of! There she is now.
The third scion of Alberia, Princess Chelle.
How do you do?
She's a PRINCESS?!
(Wow. She's even more beautiful under the light of the chandelier than when I saw her out in the sun.)
I kinda can't believe it.
Oh, my. Are you upset?
Not at all! I mean, I'm shocked, but... Thank you. Thank you very much.
Marquis Weldin is an upstanding man. I promise you he will treat you well.
Now, the stage is set for you. Go and let your feelings be known.
The stage? For what?
Come, now. Don't be obtuse. There's nothing standing in the way of your romance now.
That's why you found me a noble foster father? Why are you doing all this for me?
I simply couldn't accept what happened. It was as though you were rejecting my means, my methods, my experience.
So I decided I would show you otherwise.
This is a dream only an adult of superior cunning and intellect could have made come true. Tell me: does it delight?
It really is like a dream. It's all so brilliant. I feel like I'm in a faerie tale...
That's right. This is the start of a new chapter for you. You are starting your journey from girlhood to adulthood.
From here on, you're going to be stepping into the world of the wealthy.
Below that dazzling chandelier lies a world of scheming adults.
If you stay naive as you are now, you'll be eaten alive. You cannot remain the innocent child you are any longer.
But I know there's something you want. More than anything. And if I'm right...
*gasp*
Then proceed to the dance floor. Go shine brighter than anyone under that chandelier and claim that prize, whatever it takes.
Do as I always have, and you will succeed. Those are my final words of advice.
Thank you. Well... Here I go.
Have fun out there.
And welcome to adulthood.
As the night came to an end, so too did the ball...
Give your thanks and goodbyes to the princess, now.
Thanks, Miss...
Er, I mean! Thank you very much, Princess Chelle. Goodbye.
Until we meet again.
Mew took a little street rat and made her the daughter of a marquis...
Do mew really think this will work out in the end?
You needn't worry about that. While she is not yet an adult, she is still quite sharp.
She taught herself how to read and write, and she knows how to present herself before those of varying social status.
I think in a few years' time, she could easily become one of my adorable little kittens.
Mrowr?! Was that what mew were aiming for this whole time?!
But of course! I haven't the time to trouble myself with adoptions and the like without any sort of compensation.
Truly astounding work, Chelle. Mew never fail to impress me.
The next day...
It just occurred to meow that we've been spending this whole vacation looking after that little girl. What of YOUR vacation?
Only a few short days remain. Is there anything mew still want to do before summer draws to a close?
Well...
Why can't Leif come with me to the shore?
Because this is a sabbatical for the royal family alone. Besides, he has his own work to be concerned about.
Boo. This is going to be no fun at all...
(I never was able to have a beach day with Leif.)
(I have some growing to do if I'm still remembering that silly little daydream.)
I've done all I need to this summer.
I hadn't made any plans to begin with. I just want to spend my remaining days here relaxing.
I beg your pardon, Princess Chelle.
...Why are you here?
It has been some time, Your Highness.
I come bearing a letter from Prince Leonidas. Is...everything okay?
Oh... R-right, a letter. Well, you have my thanks for coming all this way.
(He's only here for work. And I'm not a child anymore.)
Then I shall take my leave.
N-no, wait!
(I'm NOT a child...)
(So why on earth did I stop him?!)
Leif came to deliver Chelle a letter. But just as he was about to leave, Chelle suddenly stopped him...
Is something the matter, Lady Chelle?
(Making an excuse now would be utterly disgraceful.)
(But nor can I allow this awkward silence to persist...)
Ahem. It is nothing. You should hurry back at once.
(This is the only option I have.)
That was my original intention. However...
I have decided that I will stay in this town for the night.
What?! But...why?
Prince Leonidas urged me to occasionally allow myself a bit of leisure, you see.
If I were to return now, I would be acting in direct opposition to his words.
So you have to be ordered to enjoy yourself. How very in-character for you.
(Here I'd thought he'd seen through me, but I suppose that's never something I need concern myself with around Leif.)
(And that being the case...)
Then you'll be accompanying me on a stroll along the shore this evening. Do I make myself clear?
Crystal, my lady. I shall come to fetch you later tonight.
Watch your footing, Princess.
Of course. Goodness, the beach at night is so quiet. All the good children are in bed, leaving this place for us adults.
Indeed. You can hear the waves so clearly.
I know prevarication is a lost cause on you, so I will get straight to the point.
Why did you decide to stay the night?
Well, I...
I know you were planning to leave right away. Is the reason you changed your plans because I so uncharacteristically blurted out that I wanted you to wait?
Well...
It was terribly childish of me. I cannot understand why I let myself do that.
I am a full-grown adult. I have to restrain myself from such impulsive outbursts.
Yet it was that request that convinced me to tarry here.
I could tell that it was what you wanted in your heart. It has been some time since I have heard you speak your true feelings.
It made me remember how, when you were young, you wept and begged me to go to the beach with you.
I-I cannot say I recall that myself. Honestly, you should wipe that memory from your mind.
I remember it clearly. There was a time when even you were childlike and candid about your feelings.
That is why I worry about you sometimes.
You...worry about me?
You've grown. Or rather, to put it more precisely, you were forced to grow up.
That's right. It's only natural for those in a position of power. A lady cannot guide her people if she is mired in naiveté.
I find that attitude quite admirable. But I would urge you to find time to be yourself on occasion as well.
If you could allow yourself to return to those innocent days once more, even if only for a short time...I truly believe it would be to your benefit.
Then... Could that include asking you to spoil me for the night?
If that is what you wish.
I am here to serve you and the kingdom of Alberia. I will do whatever you ask of me.
No matter what happens, I will always be at your side.
Honestly, you are just so... Rrgh.
I feel there are a few lessons you could learn from me as well. For instance, you could maybe learn to read between the lines.
You're a grown man yourself, so surely you can try to understand these things.
Never mind.
Lady Chelle! You mustn't run off on your own!
(Coded language does not work on Leif, so I no longer need it.)
(I have decided that when I am with him, I will let myself return to the halcyon days of girlhood...and be honest about how I truly feel.)
Lady Chelle!
Oh, quit your fussing. This is a vacation, so we should make the most of it!
I have a knight here I can depend on. Shouldn't that leave me free to relax?
...Indeed it should.
So let's have some fun!
I'd say this is going to make for one mewtiful memory.
Now there really is nothing more she could want this summer.
Lady Chelle, stop this...!
The night is still young, dear Leif. My fun is only just getting started!
